Package tage.audio

Class Sound

java.lang.Object
tage.audio.Sound
Direct Known Subclasses:
NIterationSound
public class Sound extends Object
This class represents a sound (sound effect, music, etc...). Only a mono channel sound file will produce spatial effects. Stereo sounds will behave like a 2D sound.
Author:
Kenneth Barnett, Mike McShaffry Modified from the SAGE Audio package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Adapted for TAGE by Scott Gordon.
See Also:
  • Game Coding Complete

      looping - - true if the sound should loop its playback; false otherwise.

    • setRollOff

      public void setRollOff(float rollOff)
      Sets the roll off factor for the sound. Set to 0 to disable distance attenuation.

      Sets the roll off factor of the Sound. This is used for distance attenuation calculations based on some attenuation model set by the API implementation of the audio manager.

      Parameters:
      rollOff - - Values G.T. 1 make the sound get quieter much quicker the further the ear gets from the source. For a value = 0 distance attenuation is disabled. Range: [0, any]

    • setMinDistance

      public void setMinDistance(float distance)
      Sets the minimum distance at which the sound started to dissipate.

      Sets the minimum distance at which distance attenuation begins.

      Parameters:
      distance - - The sound can't get any louder if we move closer to the emit point than this value; Range: [0, any]

    • setMaxDistance

      public void setMaxDistance(float distance)
      Sets the max distance at which the sound stops dissipating.

      Sets the maximum distance at which distance attenuation stops. This is used for distance attenuation calculations based on some attenuation model set by the API implementation of the audio manager.

      Parameters:
      distance - - The sound can't get any quieter if we move further away from the emit point than this value; Range: [0, any]

    • setPitch

      public void setPitch(float pitch)
      Sets the pitch of the sound.
      Parameters:
      pitch - - The pitch value that is greater than 0.

    • setEmitDirection

      public void setEmitDirection(org.joml.Vector3f direction, float coneAngle)
      Sets the emit direction of the Sound. Visually you can think of this as setting a "cone" around the Sound which will direct the sound in a particular direction.

      The zero vector (0,0,0) is the default direction which indicated that the audio source emitted from the audio player is not direction. Specifying a non-zero vector will make the source directional. Specifying a zero vector for a directional source will effectively mark it as non-direction.

      Parameters:
      direction - - The direction in which the sound is emitting.
      coneAngle - - The angle (in degrees) of the "cone" around the Sound. Default value is 360 degrees means the sound being emitted from the audio player is omni-directional.

    • getLocation

      public org.joml.Vector3f getLocation()
      Returns the location of the sound in 3D space.

    • getVelocity

      public org.joml.Vector3f getVelocity()
